item.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:

“<st data-num="01696" class="">Tell</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>, ‘<st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> a <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="02232" class="">produces offspring</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03205" class="">bears</st> a <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">child</st>,<n id="2" /> she will <st data-num="02930" class="">be unclean</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>, as she is <st data-num="02930" class="">unclean</st> during the <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> of her <st data-num="05079 01738">menstruation</st>.<n id="3" />

On<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="08066" class="">eighth</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> the <st data-num="01320" class="">flesh</st> of his <st data-num="06190" class="">foreskin</st><n id="2" /> must be <st data-num="04135" class="">circumcised</st>.

Then she will<st data-num="03427" class=""> remain</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07970 07969">thirty-three</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> in <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="02893" class="">purity</st>.<n id="2" /> She must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05060" class="">touch</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">anything</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st>, and she must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st> the <st data-num="04720" class="">sanctuary</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> of her <st data-num="02893" class="">purification</st> are <st data-num="04390" class="">fulfilled</st>.<n id="3" />
If she bears a female child, she will be impure fourteen days as during her menstrual flow, and she will remain sixty-six days in blood purity.

“‘When the days of her purification are completed for a son or for a daughter, she must bring a one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering and a young pigeon or turtledove for a sin offering to the entrance of the Meeting Tent, to the priest.

The priest is to present it before the Lord and make atonement on her behalf, and she will be clean from her flow of blood. This is the law of the one who bears a child, for the male or the female child.

If she cannot afford a sheep, then she must take two turtledoves or two young pigeons, one for a burnt offering and one for a sin offering, and the priest is to make atonement on her behalf, and she will be clean.’”
